result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Carlisle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all court costs, surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision, by 9/14/2015.   DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to  civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.
*10/22/2015 credit amended to total of 40 days.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James D Carlisle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
FILED:  Signed Order Amending Judgment of Conviction.

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect a total of 40 days of sentence credit on count one (NOT 149).
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of sentence credit awarded.

Defendant James D Carlisle in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant James D Carlisle in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by state, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statement by Louis L.

As to Count 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS with 149 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Earned Release program.  

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge by 09/14/2015. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by 9/14/2015 and through the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed,
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Written explanation of determinate sentence;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment.

Defendant James D Carlisle in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant James D Carlisle in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James D Carlisle in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant James D Carlisle in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing on 6/18/15 at 8:30 in Branch 7.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant James D Carlisle not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant James D Carlisle in court with Mary Garvin Guimont for attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant James D Carlisle in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James D Carlisle in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant James D Carlisle in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
